title: rust-lld not installed / available on riscv64gc-unknown-linux-gnu
body:
<!--

-->
rust-lld missing from ~/.cargo/bin   (after installing with "curl --proto '=https' --tlsv1.2 -sSf https://sh.rustup.rs | sh")

Verified this bevavior in a Ubuntu/23.04 guest (QEMU) and Debian/sid on hardware (Sifive VisionFive 2)

I tried this code:
```
$ curl --proto '=https' --tlsv1.2 -sSf https://sh.rustup.rs | sh
$ rustup target add wasm32-wasi
$ cargo new hello_world
$ cd hello_world
$ rustc ./src/main.rs --target wasm32-wasi --verbose
error: linker `rust-lld` not found
$ cargo build --target wasm32-wasi
   Compiling wasm_hello_world v0.1.0 (/home/user/Workspace/wasm/wasm_hello_world)
error: linker `rust-lld` not found
```
After installation:
```
$ rustup target list --installed
riscv64gc-unknown-linux-gnu
wasm32-wasi

$ ls  ~/.cargo/bin/
cargo         cargo-fmt   clippy-driver  rust-analyzer  rust-gdbgui  rustc    rustfmt
cargo-clippy  cargo-miri  rls            rust-gdb       rust-lldb    rustdoc  rustup
```

Confirmed same behaviour with nightly...
